MemorialPage.title: MemorialPage
MemorialPage.description: Represents a memorial page created for a loved one.

id.description: Unique identifier for the memorial page.

userId.description: Reference to the User who created the memorial page. (Relationship: User 1:N MemorialPage)

description.description: Description or summary of the memorial page content.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the memorial page was created.

definition.description: Stores memorial pages created by users. This collection uses path-based ownership. The 'userId' is duplicated from the parent document for Authorization Independence.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user who owns the memorial page.

params.name: memorialPageId
params.description: The unique identifier for the memorial page.

definition.description: Collection to store admin roles. The existence of a document with a user ID in this collection grants admin privileges. Uses 'Existence over Content'.

params.name: userId

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), and simple, secure rules. User data is stored in `/users/{userId}` with the profile information. Memorial pages are stored in `/users/{userId}/memorialPages/{memorialPageId}` to establish clear ownership. An admin role is managed through the `/roles_admin/{userId}` collection. The existence of a document in this collection grants admin privileges, following the principle of 'Existence over Content'. This approach avoids complex `get()` calls in security rules, supporting atomic operations and easy debugging. It also enables simple `list` operations. The structure strictly separates different types of data, ensuring a homogeneous security posture for each collection. All documents in a collection share the same security requirements.
